title: Use of uninitialized value in ftp_getrc_msg method of mod_proxy_ftp.c
vulnerability_information:
This is a Security Bug Report for mod_proxy_ftp. This bug is present in ftp_getrc_msg method of modules/proxy/mod_proxy_ftp.c file.
This is the line which causes this bug.

```c
...
  mb = apr_cpystrn(mb, response + 4, me - mb);
...
```
If ftp server returns a response like "\r\n", which has 3 characters with terminating NULL byte, apr_cpystrn method will copy uninitialized values.
Because that line uses "response + 4" as the source of data for apr_cpystrn method.

Apache Http Server version: 2.4.41
CVE-ID: [CVE-2020-1934](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2020-1934)
Apache Http server fixed security bugs: (https://httpd.apache.org/security/vulnerabilities_24.html)

Steps to reproduce
---------------------
Python 3 and Ubuntu OS 18.04 are required.


* Download attached ftpserver.py file.
* Enable proxy_module and proxy_ftp_module on Apache Http server.
* Add these lines to httpd.conf file of Apache http server.

```apache
   ProxyRequests On

   <Proxy *>
     Order deny,allow
     Deny from all
     Allow from 127.0.0.1
   </Proxy>
```

* Enter proxy settings
   * Open Setting on your Ubuntu OS.
   * Select Network
   * Click settings icon next to "Network Proxy" option.
   * Tick "Manual" option.
   * Enter Apache servers IP and port next to "FTP Proxy"
* Run Apache http server with Valgrind.
 ` sudo valgrind --leak-check=yes bin/httpd -X`
* Run attached ftpserver.py
   `sudo python3 ftpserver.py`
   * This python program will start a server on port 21.
* Open a new terminal window and run this command.
   `curl ftp://127.0.0.1`

Valgrind Output
------------------
Memcheck, a memory error detector
Copyright (C) 2002-2017, and GNU GPL'd, by Julian Seward et al.
Using Valgrind-3.13.0 and LibVEX; rerun with -h for copyright info
Command: bin/httpd -X

Thread 4:
Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s)
at 0x52E6FFE: apr_cpystrn (in /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libapr-1.so.0.6.3)
by 0x8A0A46A: ftp_getrc_msg (mod_proxy_ftp.c:403)
by 0x8A0C6CF: proxy_ftp_command (mod_proxy_ftp.c:828)

by 0x87F0259: proxy_run_scheme_handler (mod_proxy.c:3082)
by 0x87E9F08: proxy_handler (mod_proxy.c:1251)

by 0x17516E: ap_invoke_handler (config.c:444)
by 0x195E74: ap_process_async_request (http_request.c:453)

by 0x1917EB: ap_process_http_connection (http_core.c:252)
by 0x183D4A: ap_run_process_connection (connection.c:42)

Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s)
at 0x52E700F: apr_cpystrn (in /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libapr-1.so.0.6.3)
by 0x8A0A46A: ftp_getrc_msg (mod_proxy_ftp.c:403)

Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s)

by 0x87F0259: proxy_run_scheme_handler (mod_proxy.c:3082)

by 0x1A189C: process_socket (event.c:1050)
...

* Complete valgrind output is attached.

## Impact

Uninitialized data may leak data from memory.
vulnerability_information_html:
This is a Security Bug Report for mod_proxy_ftp. This bug is present in ftp_getrc_msg method of modules/proxy/mod_proxy_ftp.c file.
This is the line which causes this bug.

...
  mb = apr_cpystrn(mb, response + 4, me - mb);
...

If ftp server returns a response like "\r\n", which has 3 characters with terminating NULL byte, apr_cpystrn method will copy uninitialized values.
Because that line uses "response + 4" as the source of data for apr_cpystrn method.

Apache Http Server version: 2.4.41
CVE-ID: CVE-2020-1934
Apache Http server fixed security bugs: (https://httpd.apache.org/security/vulnerabilities_24.html)

Steps to reproduce

Python 3 and Ubuntu OS 18.04 are required.

  • Download attached ftpserver.py file.
  • Enable proxy_module and proxy_ftp_module on Apache Http server.
  • Add these lines to httpd.conf file of Apache http server.
   ProxyRequests On

   <Proxy *>
     Order deny,allow
     Deny from all
     Allow from 127.0.0.1
   </Proxy>
  • Enter proxy settings
    • Open Setting on your Ubuntu OS.
    • Select Network
    • Click settings icon next to "Network Proxy" option.
    • Tick "Manual" option.
    • Enter Apache servers IP and port next to "FTP Proxy"
  • Run Apache http server with Valgrind. sudo valgrind --leak-check=yes bin/httpd -X
  • Run attached ftpserver.py sudo python3 ftpserver.py
    • This python program will start a server on port 21.
  • Open a new terminal window and run this command. curl ftp://127.0.0.1

Valgrind Output

(https://httpd.apache.org/security/vulnerabilities_24.html).
I reported this bug to security@httpd.apache.org through email. If you can provide me your email address I can forward that email.

Best Regards,
Chamal.

activities.message:
Hello @chamal and thanks for your report,

Thanks for the clarification. I will need some further information in order to proceed.

> Enable proxy_module and proxy_ftp_module on Apache Http server.

I am not sure how to do it. Do you mind sharing the commands with me?

> Add these lines to httpd.conf file of Apache http server.

In my Apache2 directory (/etc/apache2/) there is no such file. Should I create it? How should I proceed?

> sudo valgrind --leak-check=yes bin/httpd -X

`bin/httpd` no such file or directory

Thanks,
@turtle_shell

activities.message:
Hi @turtle_shell ,

These are the updated instructions.

Requirments
---------------------
* Ubuntu 18.04
* Python 3
* Valgrind

Steps
---------
1.  Download source files for apache version 2.4.41 from 
   (https://archive.apache.org/dist/httpd/httpd-2.4.41.tar.bz2)
2.  Extract httpd-2.4.41.tar.bz2 file.
     By default files will be extracted to httpd-2.4.41 folder
3.  Build apache with debug symbols.
     Open Terminal window.
   
    `cd httpd-2.4.41/`   ==Location of extracted Apache source code.==

    ` export CFLAGS="-O0 -g"`

    `export CPPFLAGS="-O0 -g"`

      ` ./configure --prefix=/Dir/install`  ==Change "/Dir/install" to a location where you need to install.==

     ` make`

     `make install`

4.  Open /Dir/install/httpd.conf file with a text editor.
5. Enable proxy_module and proxy_ftp_module on Apache Http server.
   Uncomment these 2 lines in /Dir/install/httpd.conf.

    ```apache
     #LoadModule proxy_module modules/mod_proxy.so
    ```
    ```apache
     #LoadModule proxy_ftp_module modules/mod_proxy_ftp.so
   ```
6. Add these lines at the end of /Dir/install/httpd.conf file.

    ```apache
     ProxyRequests On 
     <Proxy *>
       Order deny,allow
       Deny from all
       Allow from 127.0.0.1 
    </Proxy>
    ```
7. Enter proxy settings for Ubuntu OS.
   a. Open Setting on your Ubuntu OS.
   b. Select Network
   c. Click settings icon next to "Network Proxy" option.
   d. Tick "Manual" option.
   e. Enter Apache servers ip and port next to "FTP Proxy"
      ex: 127.0.0.1 80
   f. Close settings window.

8. Run Apache http server with Valgrind.
    * If you are running another apache server, shutdown that server first.*

     a. Open Ubuntu terminal
     b. Change directory to apache installation directory

          `cd  /Dir/install/`

     c . Run this command to start apache web server

          `sudo valgrind --leak-check=yes bin/httpd -X`

9.  Run attached ftpserver.py

      ` sudo python3 ftpserver.py `

      **This python program will start a server on port 21.**

10. Access FTP server through Apache proxy.
    1. Open another Terminal window
    2. Run
       `curl ftp://127.0.0.1`

Now Terminal, which has Apache web server running should show Valgrind stack traces.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @turtle_shell ,

These are the updated instructions.

Requirments

  • Ubuntu 18.04
  • Python 3
  • Valgrind

Steps

  1. Download source files for apache version 2.4.41 from (https://archive.apache.org/dist/httpd/httpd-2.4.41.tar.bz2)
  2. Extract httpd-2.4.41.tar.bz2 file. By default files will be extracted to httpd-2.4.41 folder

  3. Build apache with debug symbols.
    Open Terminal window.

    cd httpd-2.4.41/ Location of extracted Apache source code.

    export CFLAGS="-O0 -g"

    export CPPFLAGS="-O0 -g"

    ./configure --prefix=/Dir/install Change "/Dir/install" to a location where you need to install.

    make

    make install

  4. Open /Dir/install/httpd.conf file with a text editor.

  5. Enable proxy_module and proxy_ftp_module on Apache Http server.
    Uncomment these 2 lines in /Dir/install/httpd.conf.

     #LoadModule proxy_module modules/mod_proxy.so

     #LoadModule proxy_ftp_module modules/mod_proxy_ftp.so

  6. Add these lines at the end of /Dir/install/httpd.conf file.

     ProxyRequests On 
 <Proxy *>
   Order deny,allow
   Deny from all
   Allow from 127.0.0.1 
</Proxy>

  7. Enter proxy settings for Ubuntu OS.
    a. Open Setting on your Ubuntu OS.
    b. Select Network
    c. Click settings icon next to "Network Proxy" option.
    d. Tick "Manual" option.
    e. Enter Apache servers ip and port next to "FTP Proxy"
    ex: 127.0.0.1 80
    f. Close settings window.

  8. Run Apache http server with Valgrind.

    • If you are running another apache server, shutdown that server first.*

    a. Open Ubuntu terminal
    b. Change directory to apache installation directory

      `cd  /Dir/install/`

    c . Run this command to start apache web server

      `sudo valgrind --leak-check=yes bin/httpd -X`

  9. Run attached ftpserver.py

    sudo python3 ftpserver.py

    This python program will start a server on port 21.

  10. Access FTP server through Apache proxy.

    1. Open another Terminal window
    2. Run curl ftp://127.0.0.1

Now Terminal, which has Apache web server running should show Valgrind stack traces.

Hi @turtle_shell ,

There is a mistake in my previous comment.
Location of httpd.conf should be /Dir/install/conf/httpd.conf instead of /Dir/install/httpd.conf.

Regards,
@turtle_shell
